div.l: His wyf bare hym a burdon̄ full strong
Men myghten here routyng a furlong
The wenche routeth eke ꝑpar companye
Aleyn̄ the clerke / that herd this melodie
He powked Iohn / and seid slepist thou
Hardest þᵘou evir sike a song / or nowe
Lo swilke a cl cl complyne / is bitwix hem alle
A wilde fire / on there bodies falle
Who herd eủere suche a ferly thing
Ye they shall have / the floure of ill endyng
Of alle this nyght / there tydes me no rest
But yit na fors / all shalbe for the best
For Iohn seid so mote he eủere thryve
If that I may / yoon wenche will I swyve
Som̄ esement has lawe shapen vs
For Iohn there is a lawe þᵗat seith thus Lines 258-60 are written at an angle, occupying four ruled lines.
That yf a man in a poynt be agreued
That in a nothir / he shalbe releved
Oure corn̄ is stolne / sothly it is no naye
And we have had / an ille fitt to daye
And syn̄ I shall have noon̄ amendement
Ayen my losse I wille have mȳn esement
Be goddes sowle / it shall noon̄ other be
This Iohn answerd Aleyn̄ avise the
The myller is a ꝑperlouse man he seide
And he owte of his slepe abraid
He myght doon vs bothe a vilanye
Aleyn̄ answered I coun̄te hȳm not worth a flye
And vp he rist / and be the wenche he crepte
